overview_of_class: This course is an introduction to the application of psychological science to our ability to understand, predict, and influence consumer behavior. In addition to covering core theories and empirical findings relevant to the science of consumer psychology, this course involves the hands-on application of research methods to address real-world marketing questions and problems. Students will be involved in the design and execution of an applied marketing research project. Students will analyze data from the project and learn how to effectively communicate the results to a non-scientific, business audience.
name: Consumer Psychology and Marketing Research
subject: PSYCH
